meanings.definition: To make (attitudes or behavior) part of one's nature by learning or unconscious assimilation.
meanings.sent1: She was internalizing the importance of kindness through her daily interactions.
meanings.sent2: He is slowly internalizing the habit of being punctual.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed to be internalizing the concept of fetch, but kept bringing back sticks instead of the ball.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the colors of the sky were internalizing into a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful visuals to help the students internalize the new vocabulary words.

meanings.definition: To incorporate (external values or beliefs) into one's own thinking.
meanings.sent1: The child was internalizing the idea of sharing after playing with friends.
meanings.sent2: She was internalizing the cultural traditions of her ancestors.
meanings.sent3: The robot was mistakenly internalizing the wrong commands, causing chaos in the factory.
meanings.sent4: The artist was internalizing the emotions of the city to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The team was internalizing the coach's motivational speeches before the big game.
